maml:description.maml:para: Gets a hash of a file in a Windows Installer-compatible format.
Get-MSIFileHash returns a 128-bit file hash in 4 separate parts, compatible with columns in the MsiFileHash table in Windows Installer packages. All non-versioned files should contain this hash.
You can optionally add these MSIHashPart1, MSIHashPart2, MSIHashPart3, and MSIHashPart4 properties to FileSystem items.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with additional properties for the file hash.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path. The value of -LiteralPath is used exactly as typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with additional properties for the file hash.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with additional properties for the file hash.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path. The value of -LiteralPath is used exactly as typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
If -passthru is not specified, Get-MSIFileHash returns an object of type Microsoft.Windows.Installer.FileHashInfo.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs the file hash of every file in the current directory as a table.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-childitem | where-object {$_.PSIsContainer -eq $False} | get-msifilehash -passthru | format-table Name, MSI* -auto

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs the name and hash parts of each file in the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Windows Installer file type.
Gets the Windows Installer file type for a given file or files.
You can optionally add this MSIFileType property to FileSystem items.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with the additional property for the file type.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path. The value of -LiteralPath is used exactly as typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with the additional property for the file type.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path.
Passes the item or items passed into this cmdlet through the pipeline with the additional property for the file type.
Specifies the path to the item or items which must resolve to a file system path. The value of -LiteralPath is used exactly as typed. No characters are interpreted as wildcards.
If -passthru is not specified, Get-MSIFileType returns an object of type System.String.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs the file type of files in the Windows Installer cache directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-childitem -path $env:WINDIR\Installer\* | where-object {$_.PSIsContainer -eq $False} | get-msifiletype -passthru | format-table Name, MSIFileType -auto

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs the Windows Installer file type for files in the Windows Installer cache directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets patch information for registered patches.
If a ProductCode is not specified, only basic information about patches will be returned.

Gets patch information for a given patch or for all patches registered to a given product or products. You can get patch information for machine-registered patches, and patch information for both user-managed- and user-unmanaged-registered patches for the current or another user.
The patch code or patch codes to retrieve patch information.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The state or states of patches to be retrieved. This can be a combination of "Applied", "Superseded", "Obsoleted", "Registered", or "All".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
Specifies the ProductCode or ProductCodes to get patch information.
The patch code or patch codes to retrieve patch information.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The state or states of patches to be retrieved. This can be a combination of "Applied", "Superseded", "Obsoleted", "Registered", or "All".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
The patch code or patch codes to retrieve patch information.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The state or states of patches to be retrieved. This can be a combination of "Applied", "Superseded", "Obsoleted", "Registered", or "All".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
Specifies the ProductCode or ProductCodes to get patch information.
Registered information for a patch or patches.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs a table of patch information for all applied patches on the machine.
This command gets file information for superseded patches on the machine.
This command gets patch information for all patches applied to products with "Office" in the name.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets product information for registered products.
Gets product information for all per-machine, user-managed, and user-unmanaged products on the machine.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
The ProductCode or ProductCodes to retrieve product information.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged patches.
The context for registered patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged patches for everyone.
The ProductCode or ProductCodes to retrieve product information.
The base type for registered product information. There are separate types for advertised and installed products that extend ProductInfo.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command outputs product information for all registered products assigned to this machine.
This command outputs all product information for products with "Visual Studio" in the name assigned to this machine.
This command gets file information for all installed user-unmanaged products.
This command gets product information for the given ProductCode.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets product information for related products.
Gets product information for related products based on an UpgradeCode.
The UpgradeCode for related products.
The UpgradeCode for related products.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all related products based on their UpgradeCode.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of source locations for products and patches.
Gets a list of network and URL source locations for products and patches.
A collection of ProductInfo or PatchInfo objects to retrieve a list of sources.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged products and patches.
The context for registered products and patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The type of sources to retrieve. This may be either "Network" or "Url".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged products and patches for everyone.
The ProductCode or ProductCodes to retrieve a list of sources.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged products and patches.
The context for registered products and patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The type of sources to retrieve. This may be either "Network" or "Url".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged products and patches for everyone.
The patch code or patch codes to retrieve a list of sources.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged products and patches.
The context for registered products and patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The type of sources to retrieve. This may be either "Network" or "Url".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged products and patches for everyone.
A collection of ProductInfo or PatchInfo objects to retrieve a list of sources.
The security identifier for a user for user-managed and user-unmanaged products and patches.
The context for registered products and patches. This can be a combination of "Machine", "UserManaged", or "UserUnmanaged".
The type of sources to retrieve. This may be either "Network" or "Url".
Whether to retrieve user-managed or user-unmanaged products and patches for everyone.
The ProductCode or ProductCodes to retrieve a list of sources.
The patch code or patch codes to retrieve a list of sources.
Source properties for products and patches.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-msisource -productcode "{1862162E-3BBC-448F-AA63-49F33152D54A}" | sort index | format-table sourcetype, path -auto

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets sources for the given product and outputs the source type and path sorted by their index.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-msiproductinfo | where-object {$_.Name -match "Office"} | get-msisource -sourcetype network | format-table path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the network sources for products with the name "Office" in the product name.
